name: Common Woolly Monkey
description: The Common Woolly Monkey is a social primate with thick, woolly fur, known for its prehensile tail.
spread_note: Found in the Amazon Basin, including Brazil, Peru, and Colombia.
food_note: Highly arboreal, often foraging in groups.
proportions: Length: 40-60 cm, tail: 60-70 cm, weight: 4-10 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 7.5 months, one infant born.
attractions: Popular in zoos for their playful behavior and social interactions.
projects_note: Threatened by habitat loss and hunting; conservation efforts are active.
breeding: Bred in captivity to support population recovery.
